item.title: Running Mysql server in container
item.description: Install mysql as container I prefer using database container for development because of environment isolation. You can remove stop/remove container whenever you want to. In this tutorial shows how to configure a mysql container for development. shell> docker pull mysql/mysql-server:5.7 shell> docker images shell> docker run --name=mysql1 -d mysql/mysql-server:5.7 It generates default root password. Use the following command to show container log shell> docker logs -f mysql1 However, It might take a few minute to initialize the container.

item.title: Serving deep learning models in production
item.description: Shipping deep learning models to production is a non-trivial task. There are many solutions out there which use cloud service providers from Google or Amazon. However, I am curious those processes, thus I want to learn them and design my serving system. Since I do not favor any specific solution, I outline the following problems which need to be solved in designing a deep learning serving system: Real-time collecting from various sources.
